content.description:
Huc geminasgeminus, -a, -um, adj. = duo, -ae, -o nunc flecte aciesacies, -ei, f. = oculus, -i, hanc aspice gentem 
Romanosque tuos. Hic Caesar et omnes IuliIulus, -i, m.: Iulus, Ascanius (the son of Aeneas) 
progeniesprogenies, -ei, f.: offspring magnum caeli ventura sub axemaxis, -is, m.: axis.
content.question: In line 2, Caesar refers to what man who became the first emperor of Rome?

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 2.B: Describe historical and cultural contexts of Latin texts.
